description: The model picker UI allows users to select a model, but the backend ignores this selection and uses a hardcoded "opus-4.5-thinking" model. Additionally, users need separate model configurations for PRD generation vs execution phases, and a "cursor auto" model option.

stories.title: Fix Hardcoded Model Bug
stories.description: As a** developer I want** my model selection to be respected So that** I can use the model I chose, not a hardcoded default
acceptance_criteria: `PrdConversationManager` uses model from `SessionConfig`, not hardcoded value
Unit test verifies selected model is passed through

stories.title: Add Auto Model Option
stories.description: As a** developer I want** an "auto" model option So that** cursor-agent can pick the best model for me
acceptance_criteria: Unit test verifies auto model handling

stories.title: Split Model Settings (Backend)
stories.description: As a** developer I want** separate model settings for PRD and execution So that** I can use different models for planning vs implementation
acceptance_criteria: Unit tests verify each model is used in correct phase

stories.title: Split Model Settings (UI)
stories.description: As a** developer I want** two separate model dropdowns in the UI So that** I can configure PRD and execution models independently

stories.title: Pass Root Path to PRD Generation
stories.description: As a** developer I want** the PRD model to know my code folder So that** it can analyze the codebase when creating requirements
acceptance_criteria: `root_path` from folder picker is passed to PRD generation endpoint
Unit test verifies root_path is accessible during PRD generation
